description: Erection of part single, part two storey side and rear extension and front porch.
decision_conditions: Due to the siting, scale, mass and form of the proposed two storey side extension, the proposed development would fresult in an incongruous and bulky addition to the host property and would not visually integrate with the character and appearance of the area. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies D3 of the London Plan 2021, policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Given the scale and siting of the proposed two storey side extension in relation to the shared boundary, the proposed development would result in an unacceptable adverse impact upon neighbouring residential amenity in terms of loss of light into the habitable rooms of No. 275 South Lane,  thereby conflicting with Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

The application seeks approval of details pursuant to conditions 05 ( refuse bins) and 06 (cycle storage)  of planning permission 24/00089/FUL dated 16.02.24 under S73A to carry out development without compliance with Condition 1 (Drawings) for Application Reference number 20/01293/FUL (Variation of Condition 1 ( Approved Plans) of  Planning Permission  18/14880/FUL (Erection of single stoey rear extension. Erection of first floor side extension to provide self contained two storey dwelling) dated 08.11. 2018 consisting of the erection of an enclosed single storey  front porch) dated 03.08.2020 . Variation to consist of the change to pitch of rear extension roof and erection upstand wall between the subject and neighbouring properties ( Retrospective).The applicant has submitted the following documents :Site Plan  Drawing Number C-101 Rev ABin store and cycle storage  plan Drawing  Number C-103Each condition is addressed in turn below.Condition 5 - Refuse bins Condition 5 states :'Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, details of enclosures and screened facilities for the storage of recycling containers and wheeled refuse bins or other refused storage containers where applicable, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority . Details should comply with Appendix 2 - Waste Management of the Residential Design (2013) SPD. The development shall be implemented in full accordance with the details as approved under this condition prior to the first occupation and retained as such thereafter. No refuse or recycling material shall be stored or placed for collection on the public highway or pavement, except on the day of collection.'In assessing the  submitted details, Officers have  reviewed the submitted drawing  and considered the proposal in the context of  ' Recycling and Waste Technical Planning Guidance', April 2021 for Sutton Council and Kingston Council. The latter  supersedes    Appendix 2 - Waste Management of the Residential Design (2013) SPD  as reference in the wording of the condition.Officers note  the applicant seeks to provide a total of 6nos bins, 3nos for each property Each set of three bins are to be contained within purpose built timber stores. Officers note the proposed bin stores are to be positioned  within the curtilage of each of the dwellings, however will be positioned away from each of the dwellings. The applicant is informed that the submitted details are agreed and that  planning condition 5 (refuse storage) of planning permission ref:24/00089/FUL  is hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with details hereby approved Condition 6 - Cycle StorageCondition 6 states'Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied cycle storage facilities shall be provided to accommodate 4no. Cycle parking spaces in accordance with a scheme to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall thereafter be implemented  in accordance  with the details as approved under this condition and the spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.' In assessing the  submitted details, Officers have  reviewed the submitted drawing  and considered the proposal  in the context of London Plan (2021)  Chapter 10 - Transport  Policy T5  Cycling, London Cycle Design Standards (TfL 2005) and RBK Sustainable Transport SPD (2013).  London Plan Policy T5 Cycling states: A (2)  seeks  securing the provision of appropriate levels of cycle parking which should be fit for purpose, secure and well located. Developments should provide cycle parking at least in accordance with the minimum standards as set out in Table 10.2 and Figure 10.3 ensuring that a minimum of two short stay and two long stay cycle parking spaces are provided where the application of the minimum standards would result in a lower provision.(B) Cycle parking should be designed and laid out in accordance with the guidance contained in the London Cycling Design Standards.  The applicant is proposing the provision of  an overall  total of 2no cycle storage units - one for each dwelling. Officers have considered the measurements  of the cycle storage  boxes  in the context of those available to purchase and London Cycling Design Standards (Version 2, September 2016).   The applicant is informed that the submitted details are agreed and that  planning condition 6 (cycle storage) of planning permission ref 24/00089/FUL  is hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with details hereby approved ConclusionThe applicant seeks to discharge condition  5 ( refuse storage) and  condition  6 ( cycle storage) of planning permission ref 24/00089/FUL. The applicant is informed that the submitted details are agreed and that  planning condition  5 ( refuse storage) and 6 (cycle storage) of planning permission ref 24/00089/FUL  is hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with details hereby approved

You are advised that if the  Local Planning Authority had been in a position to consider this modification as a standalone proposal, it would not have been recommended for approval due to  the poor design quality resulting in poor level of amenity for future users and  due to the restricted size and head height, contrary to Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy 2012 and Paragraph 135 of  the  Framework.
